Aktiviteten ved de private sygehuse er formelt set en del af Landspatientregisteret, men da de private sygehuse indberetter til den selvstændige databaseenhed MiniPas, er denne del af Landspatientregisteret dokumenteret som et særskilt register MiniPas - LPR.
tabelenhed: En række i tabellen indeholder oplysninger om en sygehuskontakt.
tabellens_indhold: Tabellen er det centrale omdrejningspunkt i stjerneskemaet for Landspatientregisteret og indeholder en række for hver kontakt i registeret. Oplysningerne i tabellen omfatter først og fremmest centrale administrative variable, som f.eks. patientens cpr-nummer, stamsygehus og -afdeling og kontaktens start- og sluttidspunkt. Herudover indeholder tabellen beregnede variable som køn, alder og sengedage. Endelig er enkelte oplysninger fra satellit-tabellerne duplikeret ind i t_adm tabellen. Det er sket af praktiske hensyn for at hjælpe brugeren, hvor der er tale om oplysninger der ofte anvendes. Eksempelvis ligger aktionsdiagnosen tilgængelig i t_adm mens den også findes i tabellen t_diag.
variablebeskrivelse: Kode til beskrivelse af modpart i trafikulykke, dvs. hvilken transportform der blev benyttet af eventuel modpart ved ulykken.Findes fra 2000 også i tabellen T_ULYK, men er koblet på T_ADM tabellen for hjælpe brugerne.

short_register_description: The National Patient Register was established in 1976 and is a national register of the activity at the Danish hospitals. The register contains a description of which diseases the patients have had at the contact to hospitals and how these diseases have been treated. The register includes all patients at public and private somatic and psychiatric hospitals. table_contents: The table is the central focal point in the star chart for the National Patient Register and contains a number for each contact in the register. The information in the table primarily includes key administrative variables, such as the patient's social security number, general hospital and ward and The start and end time of the contact. In addition, the table contains calculated variables such as gender, age and bed days. Finally, some information from the satellite tables is duplicated into the t_adm table. short_register_description: The National Patient Register was established in 1976 and is a national register of the activity at the Danish hospitals. table_contents: The table is the central focal point in the star chart for the National Patient Register and contains a number for each contact in the register. This has been done for practical reasons to help the user where information is involved. often used. For example, the action diagnosis is available in t_adm while it is also found in the table t_diag.
variable_description: Referring department. The department responsible for the referral to the patient contact in question. A department code is not unique in itself but must be linked to the hospital code in the variable C_HSGH in T_ADM, so that a 7-digit hospital department code is created. .
known_data_break_changes: No data breachThe name of the department can change over time, however, the rest appears in the classification, where it is possible to see the validity period of the department with that name. To identify the name of the referring department, look at what the department name was in the period when the contact's reference date is (D_HENDTO).
table_unit: A row in the table contains information about a hospital contact.
kendte_databrud_aendringer: Ingen databrudNavnet på afdelingen kan dog ændre sig over tid, hvilet fremgår i klassifikationen, hvor det er muligt at se gyldighedsperioden for afdelingen med det pågældende navn. For at identificere navnet på den henvisende afdeling, ses der på, hvad afdelingens navn var i den periode, hvor kontaktens henvisningsdato ligger (D_HENDTO).

variablebeskrivelse: Henvisende afdeling. Den afdeling der er ansvarlig for henvisningen til den pågældende patientkontakt.En afdelingskode er ikke unik i sig selv men skal kobles med sygehuskoden i variablen C_HSGH i T_ADM, således at der opstår en 7-cifret sygehus-afdelingskode.

Aktiviteten ved de private sygehuse er formelt set en del af Landspatientregisteret, men da de private sygehuse indberetter til den selvstændige databaseenhed MiniPas, er denne del af Landspatientregisteret dokumenteret som et særskilt register MiniPas - LPR.
tabelenhed: En række i tabellen indeholder oplysninger om en sygehuskontakt.
tabellens_indhold: Tabellen er det centrale omdrejningspunkt i stjerneskemaet for Landspatientregisteret og indeholder en række for hver kontakt i registeret. Oplysningerne i tabellen omfatter først og fremmest centrale administrative variable, som f.eks. patientens cpr-nummer, stamsygehus og -afdeling og kontaktens start- og sluttidspunkt. Herudover indeholder tabellen beregnede variable som køn, alder og sengedage. Endelig er enkelte oplysninger fra satellit-tabellerne duplikeret ind i t_adm tabellen. Det er sket af praktiske hensyn for at hjælpe brugeren, hvor der er tale om oplysninger der ofte anvendes. Eksempelvis ligger aktionsdiagnosen tilgængelig i t_adm mens den også findes i tabellen t_diag.
variablebeskrivelse: Henvisende afdeling. Den afdeling der er ansvarlig for henvisningen til den pågældende patientkontakt.En afdelingskode er ikke unik i sig selv men skal kobles med sygehuskoden i variablen C_HSGH i T_ADM, således at der opstår en 7-cifret sygehus-afdelingskode.

short_register_description: The National Patient Register was established in 1976 and is a national register of the activity at the Danish hospitals. The register contains a description of which diseases the patients have had at the contact to hospitals and how these diseases have been treated. The register includes all patients at public and private somatic and psychiatric hospitals. The activity at the private hospitals is formally part of the National Patient Register, but as the private hospitals report to it. independent database unit MiniPas, this part of the National Patient Register is documented as a separate register MiniPas - LPR.
table_contents: The table is the central focal point in the star chart for the National Patient Register and contains a number for each contact in the register. The information in the table primarily includes key administrative variables, such as the patient's social security number, general hospital and ward and The start and end time of the contact. In addition, the table contains calculated variables such as gender, age and bed days. Finally, some information from the satellite tables is duplicated into the t_adm table. This has been done for practical reasons to help the user where information is involved. often used. For example, the action diagnosis is available in t_adm while it is also found in the table t_diag.
variable_description: Referral method, code for indicating which institution the patient has been referred from.
known_data_break_changes: In 1999, reference method 6 was deleted and replaced by B, C and DI. In 2004, reference methods 3, 5, B, C and D were deleted and they were replaced by F and G
table_unit: A row in the table contains information about a hospital contact.

short_register_description: The National Patient Register was established in 1976 and is a national register of the activity at the Danish hospitals. The register contains a description of which diseases the patients have had at the contact to hospitals and how these diseases have been treated. table_contents: The table is the central focal point in the star chart for the National Patient Register and contains a number for each contact in the register. In addition, the table contains calculated variables such as gender, age and bed days. Finally, some information from the satellite tables is duplicated into the t_adm table. This has been done for practical reasons to help the user where information is involved. often used. For example, the action diagnosis is available in t_adm while it is also found in the table t_diag.
variable_description: Referring hospital. The hospital that is responsible for the referral to the patient contact in question. The variable is mandatory for all contacts that have referral method F or G, which is stated in the variable c_henm.
known_data_break_changes: No data breachThe name of the hospital may change over time, as shown in the hospital ward classification, where it is possible to see the validity period of the hospital code with that name. To identify the name of the referring hospital, look at what the name of the hospital was on the contact's referral date (D_HENDTO).
table_unit: A row in the table contains information about a hospital contact.
kendte_databrud_aendringer: Ingen databrudNavnet på sygehuset kan ændre sig over tid, hvilket fremgår i sygehus-afdelingsklassifikation, hvor det er muligt at se gyldighedsperioden for sygehuskoden med det pågældende navn. For at identificere navnet på det henvisende sygehus, ses der på, hvad sygehusets navn var på kontaktens henvisningsdato (D_HENDTO).

tabellens_indhold: Tabellen er det centrale omdrejningspunkt i stjerneskemaet for Landspatientregisteret og indeholder en række for hver kontakt i registeret. Oplysningerne i tabellen omfatter først og fremmest centrale administrative variable, som f.eks. patientens cpr-nummer, stamsygehus og -afdeling og kontaktens start- og sluttidspunkt. Herudover indeholder tabellen beregnede variable som køn, alder og sengedage. Endelig er enkelte oplysninger fra satellit-tabellerne duplikeret ind i t_adm tabellen. Det er sket af praktiske hensyn for at hjælpe brugeren, hvor der er tale om oplysninger der ofte anvendes. Eksempelvis ligger aktionsdiagnosen tilgængelig i t_adm mens den også findes i tabellen t_diag.
variablebeskrivelse: Kode til beskrivelse af, hvor patienten er indlagt fra.

short_register_description: The National Patient Register was established in 1976 and is a national register of the activity at the Danish hospitals. The register contains a description of which diseases the patients have had at the contact to hospitals and how these diseases have been treated. The register includes all patients at public and private somatic and psychiatric hospitals. The activity at the private hospitals is formally part of the National Patient Register, but as the private hospitals report to it. independent database unit MiniPas, this part of the National Patient Register is documented as a separate register MiniPas - LPR.
table_contents: The table is the central focal point in the star chart for the National Patient Register and contains a number for each contact in the register. The information in the table primarily includes key administrative variables, such as the patient's social security number, general hospital and ward and The start and end time of the contact. In addition, the table contains calculated variables such as gender, age and bed days. Finally, some information from the satellite tables is duplicated into the t_adm table. This has been done for practical reasons to help the user where information is involved. often used. For example, the action diagnosis is available in t_adm while it is also found in the table t_diag.
variable_description: Entry method. Indication of priority for the start of the contact, ie whether the contact started urgently or planned.
known_data_break_changes: Until 2014, the variable has only been filled in for inpatients (c_pattype = 0), but from 2014 it has also been filled in for outpatients (c_pattype = 2).
table_unit: A row in the table contains information about a hospital contact.
kendte_databrud_aendringer: Indtil 2014 har variablen kun været udfyldt for indlagte patienter (c_pattype= 0), men fra 2014 er den også udfyldt for ambulante (c_pattype= 2).
kort_om_registeret: Landspatientregisteret er oprettet i 1976 og er et nationalt register over aktiviteten ved de danske sygehuse. Registeret indeholder en beskrivelse over hvilke sygdomme, som patienterne har haft ved kontakten til sygehuse, og hvordan disse sygdomme er blevet behandlet. Hertil kommer en række oplysninger om patienternes bopæl, køn, alder, indlæggelses- og udskrivningstidspunkt mv.Registeret omfatter alle patienter på offentlige og private somatiske og psykiatriske sygehuse. Aktiviteten ved de private sygehuse er formelt set en del af Landspatientregisteret, men da de private sygehuse indberetter til den selvstændige databaseenhed MiniPas, er denne del af Landspatientregisteret dokumenteret som et særskilt register MiniPas - LPR.
tabelenhed: En række i tabellen indeholder oplysninger om en sygehuskontakt.
tabellens_indhold: Tabellen er det centrale omdrejningspunkt i stjerneskemaet for Landspatientregisteret og indeholder en række for hver kontakt i registeret. Oplysningerne i tabellen omfatter først og fremmest centrale administrative variable, som f.eks. patientens cpr-nummer, stamsygehus og -afdeling og kontaktens start- og sluttidspunkt. Eksempelvis ligger aktionsdiagnosen tilgængelig i t_adm mens den også findes i tabellen t_diag.
variablebeskrivelse: Indskrivningsmåde. Angivelse af prioritet for kontaktens start, dvs. om kontakten startede akut eller planlagt.

short_register_description: The National Patient Register was established in 1976 and is a national register of the activity at the Danish hospitals. The register contains a description of which diseases the patients have had at the contact to hospitals and how these diseases have been treated. The register includes all patients at public and private somatic and psychiatric hospitals. This has been done for practical reasons to help the user where information is involved. often used. For example, the action diagnosis is available in t_adm while it is also found in the table t_diag.
variable_description: Residence municipality, indicates which municipality the patient was resident in on the contact's enrollment date.
known_data_break_changes: During the municipal reform in 2007, there were significant changes in the municipal classification, as many codes were closed and new ones were opened. However, the old municipal codes may well appear in the National Patient Register for patient contacts that have begun after 2007.
table_unit: A row in the table contains information about a hospital contact.
kendte_databrud_aendringer: Ved kommunalreformen i 2007 skete der væsentlige ændringer i kommuneklassifikationen, da mange koder blev lukket og nye blev åbnet.De gamle kommunekoder kan dog godt optræde i Landspatientregisteret for patientkontakter, der er påbegyndt efter 2007.

short_register_description: The National Patient Register was established in 1976 and is a national register of the activity at the Danish hospitals. The register contains a description of which diseases the patients have had at the contact to hospitals and how these diseases have been treated. The register includes all patients at public and private somatic and psychiatric hospitals. The activity at the private hospitals is formally part of the National Patient Register, but as the private hospitals report to it. independent database unit MiniPas, this part of the National Patient Register is documented as a separate register MiniPas - LPR.
table_contents: The table is the central focal point in the star chart for the National Patient Register and contains a number for each contact in the register. The information in the table primarily includes key administrative variables, such as the patient's social security number, general hospital and ward and The start and end time of the contact. In addition, the table contains calculated variables such as gender, age and bed days. Finally, some information from the satellite tables is duplicated into the t_adm table. This has been done for practical reasons to help the user where information is involved. often used. For example, the action diagnosis is available in t_adm while it is also found in the table t_diag.
variable_description: The type of patient for the contact in question. Indication of the patient's administrative relationship with the hospital, ie whether the patient is hospitalized, outpatient or is a part - time or emergency room patient.
known_data_break_changes: Up to and including 1993, only patient type 0 (round-the-clock patient) has been registered in LPR, although other patient types have existed in the classification since 1977, which appears from the set of values. In 2002, part-time patient was eliminated (1). In 2002, there was disagreement across hospitals as to how patients who would previously be registered as part-time patients were registered, and in some hospitals they were registered as outpatients and others as inpatients (round-the-clock patients). In 2014, the emergency room patient (3) and was replaced by outpatient (2) with enrollment mode acute (c_indm = 1).
table_unit: A row in the table contains information about a hospital contact.
kendte_databrud_aendringer: Frem til og med 1993 er der i LPR kun blevet registreret patienttype 0 (heldøgnspatient), selvom der i klassifikationen har eksisteret andre patienttyper helt tilbage fra 1977, hvilket fremgår af værdisættet.I 2002 udgik deldøgnspatient (1).Efter 2002 er det uens på tværs af sygehusene, hvordan de patienter, der før ville være registrerede som deldøgnspatienter, blev registreret. På visse sygehuse blev de registreret som ambulante patienter og andre som indlagte patienter (heldøgnspatienter). I 2014 udgik skadestuepatient (3) og blev erstattet af ambulant patient (2) med indskrivningsmåde akut (c_indm=1).
kort_om_registeret: Landspatientregisteret er oprettet i 1976 og er et nationalt register over aktiviteten ved de danske sygehuse. Registeret indeholder en beskrivelse over hvilke sygdomme, som patienterne har haft ved kontakten til sygehuse, og hvordan disse sygdomme er blevet behandlet. Hertil kommer en række oplysninger om patienternes bopæl, køn, alder, indlæggelses- og udskrivningstidspunkt mv.Registeret omfatter alle patienter på offentlige og private somatiske og psykiatriske sygehuse. tabelenhed: En række i tabellen indeholder oplysninger om en sygehuskontakt.
tabellens_indhold: Tabellen er det centrale omdrejningspunkt i stjerneskemaet for Landspatientregisteret og indeholder en række for hver kontakt i registeret. Oplysningerne i tabellen omfatter først og fremmest centrale administrative variable, som f.eks. patientens cpr-nummer, stamsygehus og -afdeling og kontaktens start- og sluttidspunkt. Herudover indeholder tabellen beregnede variable som køn, alder og sengedage. Endelig er enkelte oplysninger fra satellit-tabellerne duplikeret ind i t_adm tabellen. Det er sket af praktiske hensyn for at hjælpe brugeren, hvor der er tale om oplysninger der ofte anvendes. Eksempelvis ligger aktionsdiagnosen tilgængelig i t_adm mens den også findes i tabellen t_diag.
variablebeskrivelse: Patientens køn, bestemt ud fra det sidste ciffer i CPR-nummeret

short_register_description: The National Patient Register was established in 1976 and is a national register of the activity at the Danish hospitals. The register contains a description of which diseases the patients have had at the contact to hospitals and how these diseases have been treated. The register includes all patients at public and private somatic and psychiatric hospitals. The activity at the private hospitals is formally part of the National Patient Register, but as the private hospitals report to it. independent database unit MiniPas, this part of the National Patient Register is documented as a separate register MiniPas - LPR.
table_contents: The table is the central focal point in the star chart for the National Patient Register and contains a number for each contact in the register. The information in the table primarily includes key administrative variables, such as the patient's social security number, general hospital and ward and The start and end time of the contact. In addition, the table contains calculated variables such as gender, age and bed days. Finally, some information from the satellite tables is duplicated into the t_adm table. This has been done for practical reasons to help the user where information is involved. often used. For example, the action diagnosis is available in t_adm while it is also found in the table t_diag.
variable_description: Patient's tribal hospital defined as the hospital where the patient is admitted.
known_data_break_changes: No data breach. The name of the hospital may change over time, as shown in the hospital ward classification, where it is possible to see the validity period of the hospital code with that name. To identify the name of a contact's parent hospital, see , what the name of the hospital was during the period in which the contact end date is (D_UDDTO). For unfinished contacts, it is the latest valid version of the hospital code in the classification that is current.
table_unit: A row in the table contains information about a hospital contact.
kendte_databrud_aendringer: Ingen databrud.Navnet på sygehuset kan ændre sig over tid, hvilket fremgår af sygehus-afdelingsklassifikationen, hvor det er muligt at se gyldighedsperioden for sygehuskoden med det pågældende navn. For at identificere navnet på en kontakts stamsygehus, ses der på, hvad sygehusets navn var i den periode, hvor kontaktens afslutningsdato ligger (D_UDDTO). For uafsluttede kontakter er det den senest gældende version af sygehuskoden i klassifikationen der er aktuel.
kort_om_registeret: Landspatientregisteret er oprettet i 1976 og er et nationalt register over aktiviteten ved de danske sygehuse. Registeret indeholder en beskrivelse over hvilke sygdomme, som patienterne har haft ved kontakten til sygehuse, og hvordan disse sygdomme er blevet behandlet. Hertil kommer en række oplysninger om patienternes bopæl, køn, alder, indlæggelses- og udskrivningstidspunkt mv.Registeret omfatter alle patienter på offentlige og private somatiske og psykiatriske sygehuse. Aktiviteten ved de private sygehuse er formelt set en del af Landspatientregisteret, men da de private sygehuse indberetter til den selvstændige databaseenhed MiniPas, er denne del af Landspatientregisteret dokumenteret som et særskilt register MiniPas - LPR.
tabelenhed: En række i tabellen indeholder oplysninger om en sygehuskontakt.
tabellens_indhold: Tabellen er det centrale omdrejningspunkt i stjerneskemaet for Landspatientregisteret og indeholder en række for hver kontakt i registeret. Oplysningerne i tabellen omfatter først og fremmest centrale administrative variable, som f.eks. patientens cpr-nummer, stamsygehus og -afdeling og kontaktens start- og sluttidspunkt. Herudover indeholder tabellen beregnede variable som køn, alder og sengedage. Endelig er enkelte oplysninger fra satellit-tabellerne duplikeret ind i t_adm tabellen. Det er sket af praktiske hensyn for at hjælpe brugeren, hvor der er tale om oplysninger der ofte anvendes. Eksempelvis ligger aktionsdiagnosen tilgængelig i t_adm mens den også findes i tabellen t_diag.
variablebeskrivelse: Patientens stamsygehus defineret som det sygehus, hvor patienten er indskrevet.

variable_description: Hospital county, indication of which county the main hospital is located in (organizationally) on the contact's enrollment date. Since the counties were closed on 31 December 2006 as a result of the municipal reform, this variable has no real significance for patient contacts that have begun. hereafter.
table_unit: A row in the table contains information about a hospital contact.

variablebeskrivelse: Sygehusamt, angivelse af hvilket amt stamsygehuset er placeret i (organisatorisk) på kontaktens indskrivningsdato.Da amterne blev nedlagt d. 31. december 2006 som en følge af kommunalreformen, har denne variabel ikke nogen reel betydning for patientkontakter der er påbegyndt herefter.

short_register_description: The National Patient Register was established in 1976 and is a national register of the activity at the Danish hospitals. The register contains a description of which diseases the patients have had at the contact to hospitals and how these diseases have been treated. The register includes all patients at public and private somatic and psychiatric hospitals. The activity at the private hospitals is formally part of the National Patient Register, but as the private hospitals report to it. independent database unit MiniPas, this part of the National Patient Register is documented as a separate register MiniPas - LPR.
table_contents: The table is the central focal point in the star chart for the National Patient Register and contains a number for each contact in the register. In addition, the table contains calculated variables such as gender, age and bed days. Finally, some information from the satellite tables is duplicated into the t_adm table. This has been done for practical reasons to help the user where information is involved. often used. For example, the action diagnosis is available in t_adm while it is also found in the table t_diag.
variable_description: The main department's main specialty. The specialty code is taken from the hospital ward classification, where the main specialty is defined as the first of the ward's 4 specialties. If a ward has changed specialty code over time, it is always the specialty code that relates to the version of the ward. on the end date of the contact. If the contact is unfinished, the latest valid version of the department is used.
table_unit: A row in the table contains information about a hospital contact.

variablebeskrivelse: Stamafdelingens hovedspeciale.Specialekoden hentes fra sygehusafdelingsklassifikationen, hvor hovedspecialet er defineret som det første af afdelingens 4 specialer.Hvis en afdeling har skiftet specialekode over tid, er det altid specialekoden der knytter sig til den version af afdelingen, som er gældende på kontaktens afslutningsdato. Hvis kontakten er uafsluttet er det den senest gældende version af afdelingen der bruges.

variable_description: Termination method, indication of how the patient has been terminated and possibly which institution the patient has been terminated for. For example, whether the patient has been terminated to another hospital ward or to his own doctor. .
known_data_break_changes: In 2004 the values ​​3, 5, B and C were deleted and replaced by F and G.
table_unit: A row in the table contains information about a hospital contact.
kendte_databrud_aendringer: I 2004 udgik værdierne 3, 5, B og C og blev erstattet af F og G.

variable_description: Code to describe whether the hospitalization is due to an accident. In 1987, the variable was deleted, and then the information can be found in the more general variable c_kontaars, which describes the cause of the patient contact, eg whether the contact is due to an accident.
table_unit: A row in the table contains information about a hospital contact.

tabellens_indhold: Tabellen er det centrale omdrejningspunkt i stjerneskemaet for Landspatientregisteret og indeholder en række for hver kontakt i registeret. Oplysningerne i tabellen omfatter først og fremmest centrale administrative variable, som f.eks. patientens cpr-nummer, stamsygehus og -afdeling og kontaktens start- og sluttidspunkt. Herudover indeholder tabellen beregnede variable som køn, alder og sengedage. Endelig er enkelte oplysninger fra satellit-tabellerne duplikeret ind i t_adm tabellen. Det er sket af praktiske hensyn for at hjælpe brugeren, hvor der er tale om oplysninger der ofte anvendes. Eksempelvis ligger aktionsdiagnosen tilgængelig i t_adm mens den også findes i tabellen t_diag.
variablebeskrivelse: Kode til beskrivelse af om indlæggelsen skyldes en ulykke.I 1987 udgik variablen, og herefter kan oplysningen findes i den mere generelle variabel c_kontaars, der beskriver årsagen til patientkontakten, f.eks. om kontakten skyldes en ulykke.

short_register_description: The National Patient Register was established in 1976 and is a national register of the activity at the Danish hospitals. The register contains a description of which diseases the patients have had at the contact to hospitals and how these diseases have been treated. The register includes all patients at public and private somatic and psychiatric hospitals. The activity at the private hospitals is formally part of the National Patient Register, but as the private hospitals report to it. independent database unit MiniPas, this part of the National Patient Register is documented as a separate register MiniPas - LPR.
table_contents: The table is the central focal point in the star chart for the National Patient Register and contains a number for each contact in the register. The information in the table primarily includes key administrative variables, such as the patient's social security number, general hospital and ward and The start and end time of the contact. In addition, the table contains calculated variables such as gender, age and bed days. Finally, some information from the satellite tables is duplicated into the t_adm table. This has been done for practical reasons to help the user where information is involved. often used. For example, the action diagnosis is available in t_adm while it is also found in the table t_diag.
variable_description: Code to describe whether the hospitalization is due to an accident. In 1987, the variable was deleted, and then the information can be found in the more general variable c_kontaars, which describes the cause of the patient contact, eg whether the contact is due to an accident.
table_unit: A row in the table contains information about a hospital contact.
kort_om_registeret: Landspatientregisteret er oprettet i 1976 og er et nationalt register over aktiviteten ved de danske sygehuse. Registeret indeholder en beskrivelse over hvilke sygdomme, som patienterne har haft ved kontakten til sygehuse, og hvordan disse sygdomme er blevet behandlet. Hertil kommer en række oplysninger om patienternes bopæl, køn, alder, indlæggelses- og udskrivningstidspunkt mv.Registeret omfatter alle patienter på offentlige og private somatiske og psykiatriske sygehuse. Aktiviteten ved de private sygehuse er formelt set en del af Landspatientregisteret, men da de private sygehuse indberetter til den selvstændige databaseenhed MiniPas, er denne del af Landspatientregisteret dokumenteret som et særskilt register MiniPas - LPR.

short_register_description: The National Patient Register was established in 1976 and is a national register of the activity at the Danish hospitals. The register contains a description of which diseases the patients have had at the contact to hospitals and how these diseases have been treated. variable_description: The contact's update date, ie the date of the last change of the contact. Note that this date can be a long time after the contact's end date, as the hospitals sometimes make post-registrations, as well as re-reports of faulty contacts.
known_data_break_changes: Update date for the years 2000-2004 is in the table t_updateto
table_unit: A row in the table contains information about a hospital contact.
kendte_databrud_aendringer: Opdateringsdato for årene 2000-2004 ligger i tabellen t_opdatdto

variablebeskrivelse: Kontaktens opdateringsdato, dvs. dato for seneste ændring af kontakten.Bemærk at denne dato kan ligge lang tid efter kontaktens afslutningsdato, da sygehusene til tider foretager efterregistreringer, samt genindberetninger af fejlkontakter.

known_data_break_changes: Update date for the years 2000-2004 is in the table t_updateto
table_unit: A row in the table contains information about a hospital contact.
kendte_databrud_aendringer: Opdateringsdato for årene 2000-2004 ligger i tabellen t_opdatdto
kort_om_registeret: Landspatientregisteret er oprettet i 1976 og er et nationalt register over aktiviteten ved de danske sygehuse. Registeret indeholder en beskrivelse over hvilke sygdomme, som patienterne har haft ved kontakten til sygehuse, og hvordan disse sygdomme er blevet behandlet. Hertil kommer en række oplysninger om patienternes bopæl, køn, alder, indlæggelses- og udskrivningstidspunkt mv.Registeret omfatter alle patienter på offentlige og private somatiske og psykiatriske sygehuse. Aktiviteten ved de private sygehuse er formelt set en del af Landspatientregisteret, men da de private sygehuse indberetter til den selvstændige databaseenhed MiniPas, er denne del af Landspatientregisteret dokumenteret som et særskilt register MiniPas - LPR.
tabelenhed: En række i tabellen indeholder oplysninger om en sygehuskontakt.
tabellens_indhold: Tabellen er det centrale omdrejningspunkt i stjerneskemaet for Landspatientregisteret og indeholder en række for hver kontakt i registeret. Oplysningerne i tabellen omfatter først og fremmest centrale administrative variable, som f.eks. patientens cpr-nummer, stamsygehus og -afdeling og kontaktens start- og sluttidspunkt. Herudover indeholder tabellen beregnede variable som køn, alder og sengedage. Endelig er enkelte oplysninger fra satellit-tabellerne duplikeret ind i t_adm tabellen. Det er sket af praktiske hensyn for at hjælpe brugeren, hvor der er tale om oplysninger der ofte anvendes. Eksempelvis ligger aktionsdiagnosen tilgængelig i t_adm mens den også findes i tabellen t_diag.
variablebeskrivelse: Kontaktens opdateringsdato, dvs. dato for seneste ændring af kontakten.Bemærk at denne dato kan ligge lang tid efter kontaktens afslutningsdato, da sygehusene til tider foretager efterregistreringer, samt genindberetninger af fejlkontakter.

short_register_description: The National Patient Register was established in 1976 and is a national register of the activity at the Danish hospitals. The register contains a description of which diseases the patients have had at the contact to hospitals and how these diseases have been treated. The register includes all patients at public and private somatic and psychiatric hospitals. The activity at the private hospitals is formally part of the National Patient Register, but as the private hospitals report to it. independent database unit MiniPas, this part of the National Patient Register is documented as a separate register MiniPas - LPR.
table_contents: The table is the central focal point in the star chart for the National Patient Register and contains a number for each contact in the register. The information in the table primarily includes key administrative variables, such as the patient's social security number, general hospital and ward and The start and end time of the contact. In addition, the table contains calculated variables such as gender, age and bed days. Finally, some information from the satellite tables is duplicated into the t_adm table. This has been done for practical reasons to help the user where information is involved. often used. For example, the action diagnosis is available in t_adm while it is also found in the table t_diag.
variable_description: Contact end date defined as discharge date for inpatients, date of end of part-time treatment and date of end of outpatient course for outpatients. If the end date of an emergency room contact is not reported, the end date is set equal to the contact start date, so that the contact date always. will have an expiration date in the register.
known_data_break_changes: For admissions started before 2015, the end date is mandatory to report, and thereafter it is voluntary for planned admissions. For acute admissions and acute outpatient contacts, the end date is mandatory. The variable is thus always filled in for all acute patient contacts and emergency room contacts. all admissions with start date before 2015.
table_unit: A row in the table contains information about a hospital contact.
kendte_databrud_aendringer: For indlæggelser der er påbegyndt før 2015 er afslutningsdatoen obligatorisk at indberette, og herefter er den frivillig for planlagte indlæggelser. For akutte indlæggelser og akutte ambulante kontakter er afslutningsdatoen obligatorisk. Variablen er således altid udfyldt for alle akutte patientkontakter og skadestuekontakter samt alle indlæggelser med startdato før 2015.
kort_om_registeret: Landspatientregisteret er oprettet i 1976 og er et nationalt register over aktiviteten ved de danske sygehuse. Registeret indeholder en beskrivelse over hvilke sygdomme, som patienterne har haft ved kontakten til sygehuse, og hvordan disse sygdomme er blevet behandlet. tabelenhed: En række i tabellen indeholder oplysninger om en sygehuskontakt.
tabellens_indhold: Tabellen er det centrale omdrejningspunkt i stjerneskemaet for Landspatientregisteret og indeholder en række for hver kontakt i registeret. Eksempelvis ligger aktionsdiagnosen tilgængelig i t_adm mens den også findes i tabellen t_diag.
variablebeskrivelse: Kontaktens afslutningsdato defineret som udskrivningsdato for indlagte patienter, dato for afslutning af deldøgnsbehandling og dato for afslutning af ambulant forløb for ambulante patienter. Såfremt afslutningsdatoen for en skadestuekontakt ikke er indberettet, sættes afslutningsdatoen lig med kontaktens startdato, således at skadestuekontakter altid vil have en afslutningsdato i registeret.

short_register_description: The National Patient Register was established in 1976 and is a national register of the activity at the Danish hospitals. The register contains a description of which diseases the patients have had at the contact to hospitals and how these diseases have been treated. The register includes all patients at public and private somatic and psychiatric hospitals. The activity at the private hospitals is formally part of the National Patient Register, but as the private hospitals report to it. independent database unit MiniPas, this part of the National Patient Register is documented as a separate register MiniPas - LPR.
table_contents: The table is the central focal point in the star chart for the National Patient Register and contains a number for each contact in the register. This has been done for practical reasons to help the user where information is involved. often used. For example, the action diagnosis is available in t_adm while it is also found in the table t_diag.
variable_description: The variable contains a serial number that is unique to a contact. Recnum is used to connect data about a contact from the various data sets that make up the National Patient Register.
known_data_break_changes: Recnum is unique within an update of the National Patient Register. This means that one contact can get a new recnum when updating the register, and that specific recnum when updating the register can be reused for another contact.
table_unit: A row in the table contains information about a hospital contact.
kendte_databrud_aendringer: Recnum er unik inden for en opdatering af Landspatientregisteret. Det betyder at én kontakt kan få et nyt recnum ved opdatering af registeret, og at konkret recnum ved opdatering af registreret kan blive genbrugt til en anden kontakt.

variablebeskrivelse: Variablen indeholder et løbenummer som er unikt for en kontakt. Recnum anvendes til at koble data om en kontakt fra de forskellige datasæt, der udgør Landspatientregisteret.

tabellens_indhold: Tabellen er det centrale omdrejningspunkt i stjerneskemaet for Landspatientregisteret og indeholder en række for hver kontakt i registeret. Oplysningerne i tabellen omfatter først og fremmest centrale administrative variable, som f.eks. patientens cpr-nummer, stamsygehus og -afdeling og kontaktens start- og sluttidspunkt. Herudover indeholder tabellen beregnede variable som køn, alder og sengedage. Endelig er enkelte oplysninger fra satellit-tabellerne duplikeret ind i t_adm tabellen. Det er sket af praktiske hensyn for at hjælpe brugeren, hvor der er tale om oplysninger der ofte anvendes. Eksempelvis ligger aktionsdiagnosen tilgængelig i t_adm mens den også findes i tabellen t_diag.
variablebeskrivelse: Antallet af behandlingsdage for indlagte patienter, deldøgnspatienter og skadestuepatienter. For ambulante patienter angiver variablen antallet af besøg.

short_register_description: The National Patient Register was established in 1976 and is a national register of the activity at the Danish hospitals. The register contains a description of which diseases the patients have had at the contact to hospitals and how these diseases have been treated. The register includes all patients at public and private somatic and psychiatric hospitals. The activity at the private hospitals is formally part of the National Patient Register, but as the private hospitals report to it. independent database unit MiniPas, this part of the National Patient Register is documented as a separate register MiniPas - LPR.
table_contents: The table is the central focal point in the star chart for the National Patient Register and contains a number for each contact in the register. The information in the table primarily includes key administrative variables, such as the patient's social security number, general hospital and ward and The start and end time of the contact. In addition, the table contains calculated variables such as gender, age and bed days. Finally, some information from the satellite tables is duplicated into the t_adm table. This has been done for practical reasons to help the user where information is involved. often used. For example, the action diagnosis is available in t_adm while it is also found in the table t_diag.
variable_description: The variable indicates the contact's social security number. For foreigners or strangers enter a replacement CPR number.
table_unit: A row in the table contains information about a hospital contact.
kort_om_registeret: Landspatientregisteret er oprettet i 1976 og er et nationalt register over aktiviteten ved de danske sygehuse. Registeret indeholder en beskrivelse over hvilke sygdomme, som patienterne har haft ved kontakten til sygehuse, og hvordan disse sygdomme er blevet behandlet. Hertil kommer en række oplysninger om patienternes bopæl, køn, alder, indlæggelses- og udskrivningstidspunkt mv.Registeret omfatter alle patienter på offentlige og private somatiske og psykiatriske sygehuse. Aktiviteten ved de private sygehuse er formelt set en del af Landspatientregisteret, men da de private sygehuse indberetter til den selvstændige databaseenhed MiniPas, er denne del af Landspatientregisteret dokumenteret som et særskilt register MiniPas - LPR.

short_register_description: The National Patient Register was established in 1976 and is a national register of the activity at the Danish hospitals. The register contains a description of which diseases the patients have had at the contact to hospitals and how these diseases have been treated. The register includes all patients at public and private somatic and psychiatric hospitals. table_contents: The table contains information about canceled procedures, ie procedures that have been planned, but which were never performed due to cancellation
variable_description: The ward that should have performed the procedure that was canceled. A ward code is not unique in itself but must be linked with the hospital code in the variable C_OSGH in T_AFL, so that a 7-digit hospital ward code is created.
known_data_break_changes: The name of the ward may change over time, which is stated in the hospital ward classification, where it is possible to see the validity period for each ward with that name. To identify the name of a contact's ward, see, what the name of the department was during the period in which the canceled procedure should have taken place, as shown by the variable d_odto in the same table.
table_unit: A row in the table contains information about a canceled procedure.
kendte_databrud_aendringer: Navnet på afdelingen kan ændre sig over tid, hvilet fremgår af sygehus-afdelingsklassifikation, hvor det er muligt at se gyldighedsperioden for hver enkelt afdeling med det pågældende navn. For at identificere navnet på en kontakts stamafdeling, ses der på, hvad afdelingens navn var i den periode, hvor den aflyste procedure skulle have fundet sted, hvilket fremgå af variablen d_odto i samme tabel.
kort_om_registeret: Landspatientregisteret er oprettet i 1976 og er et nationalt register over aktiviteten ved de danske sygehuse. Registeret indeholder en beskrivelse over hvilke sygdomme, som patienterne har haft ved kontakten til sygehuse, og hvordan disse sygdomme er blevet behandlet. Hertil kommer en række oplysninger om patienternes bopæl, køn, alder, indlæggelses- og udskrivningstidspunkt mv.Registeret omfatter alle patienter på offentlige og private somatiske og psykiatriske sygehuse. Aktiviteten ved de private sygehuse er formelt set en del af Landspatientregisteret, men da de private sygehuse indberetter til den selvstændige databaseenhed MiniPas, er denne del af Landspatientregisteret dokumenteret som et særskilt register MiniPas - LPR.
tabelenhed: En række i tabellen indeholder oplysninger om en aflyst procedure.
tabellens_indhold: Tabellen indeholder oplysninger om aflyste procedurer, dvs. procedurer der har været planlagt, men som aldrig blev udført pga. aflysning
variablebeskrivelse: Afdelingen som skulle have udført den procedure, der blev aflyst.En afdelingskode er ikke unik i sig selv men skal kobles med sygehuskoden i variablen C_OSGH i T_AFL, således at der opstår en 7-cifret sygehus-afdelingskode.

short_register_description: The National Patient Register was established in 1976 and is a national register of the activity at the Danish hospitals. The register contains a description of which diseases the patients have had at the contact to hospitals and how these diseases have been treated. The register includes all patients at public and private somatic and psychiatric hospitals. The activity at the private hospitals is formally part of the National Patient Register, but as the private hospitals report to it. independent database unit MiniPas, this part of the National Patient Register is documented as a separate register MiniPas - LPR.
table_contents: The table contains information about canceled procedures, ie procedures that have been planned, but which were never performed due to cancellation
variable_description: Classification code that describes what is the basis for cancellation of procedure, eg that the procedure has been canceled due to the patient's condition. The procedure that has been canceled can be found as an additional code to the cancellation code in the variable c_tilopr.
known_data_break_changes: It is mandatory to report canceled operations planned for implementation in the period 1 January 1999- 1 October 2006.
table_unit: A row in the table contains information about a canceled procedure.
kendte_databrud_aendringer: Det er obligatorisk at indberette aflyste operationer planlagt til gennemførelse i perioden 1. januar 1999- 1. oktober 2006.
kort_om_registeret: Landspatientregisteret er oprettet i 1976 og er et nationalt register over aktiviteten ved de danske sygehuse. Registeret indeholder en beskrivelse over hvilke sygdomme, som patienterne har haft ved kontakten til sygehuse, og hvordan disse sygdomme er blevet behandlet. Hertil kommer en række oplysninger om patienternes bopæl, køn, alder, indlæggelses- og udskrivningstidspunkt mv.Registeret omfatter alle patienter på offentlige og private somatiske og psykiatriske sygehuse. Aktiviteten ved de private sygehuse er formelt set en del af Landspatientregisteret, men da de private sygehuse indberetter til den selvstændige databaseenhed MiniPas, er denne del af Landspatientregisteret dokumenteret som et særskilt register MiniPas - LPR.
tabelenhed: En række i tabellen indeholder oplysninger om en aflyst procedure.
tabellens_indhold: Tabellen indeholder oplysninger om aflyste procedurer, dvs. procedurer der har været planlagt, men som aldrig blev udført pga. aflysning
variablebeskrivelse: Klassifikationskode der beskriver, hvad der ligger til grund for aflysning af procedure, f.eks. at proceduren er aflyst pga. patientens tilstand.Selve proceduren der er blevet aflyst kan findes som tillægskode til aflysningskoden i variablen c_tilopr.

short_register_description: The National Patient Register was established in 1976 and is a national register of the activity at the Danish hospitals. The register contains a description of which diseases the patients have had at the contact to hospitals and how these diseases have been treated. The register includes all patients at public and private somatic and psychiatric hospitals. The activity at the private hospitals is formally part of the National Patient Register, but as the private hospitals report to it. independent database unit MiniPas, this part of the National Patient Register is documented as a separate register MiniPas - LPR.
table_contents: The table contains information about canceled procedures, ie procedures that have been planned, but which were never performed due to cancellation
variable_description: Indication of whether there is an additional code to the cancellation code (C_OPR). The additional code itself is found in the variable C_TILOPR.
table_unit: A row in the table contains information about a canceled procedure.
kort_om_registeret: Landspatientregisteret er oprettet i 1976 og er et nationalt register over aktiviteten ved de danske sygehuse. Registeret indeholder en beskrivelse over hvilke sygdomme, som patienterne har haft ved kontakten til sygehuse, og hvordan disse sygdomme er blevet behandlet. Hertil kommer en række oplysninger om patienternes bopæl, køn, alder, indlæggelses- og udskrivningstidspunkt mv.Registeret omfatter alle patienter på offentlige og private somatiske og psykiatriske sygehuse. Aktiviteten ved de private sygehuse er formelt set en del af Landspatientregisteret, men da de private sygehuse indberetter til den selvstændige databaseenhed MiniPas, er denne del af Landspatientregisteret dokumenteret som et særskilt register MiniPas - LPR.
tabelenhed: En række i tabellen indeholder oplysninger om en aflyst procedure.
tabellens_indhold: Tabellen indeholder oplysninger om aflyste procedurer, dvs. procedurer der har været planlagt, men som aldrig blev udført pga. aflysning
variablebeskrivelse: Angivelse af om der er en tillægskode til koden for aflysningen (C_OPR).Selve tillægskoden findes i variablen C_TILOPR.

short_register_description: The National Patient Register was established in 1976 and is a national register of the activity at the Danish hospitals. The register contains a description of which diseases the patients have had at the contact to hospitals and how these diseases have been treated. The register includes all patients at public and private somatic and psychiatric hospitals. The activity at the private hospitals is formally part of the National Patient Register, but as the private hospitals report to it. independent database unit MiniPas, this part of the National Patient Register is documented as a separate register MiniPas - LPR.
table_contents: The table contains information about canceled procedures, ie procedures that have been planned, but which were never performed due to cancellation
variable_description: The hospital which should have performed the procedure that was canceled.
known_data_break_changes: No data breach. The name of the hospital may change over time, as shown by the hospital ward classification, where it is possible to see the validity period of the hospital code with that name. To identify the name of the hospital, look at what the name of the hospital was during the period in which the canceled procedure should have taken place, as shown by the variable d_odto in the same table.
table_unit: A row in the table contains information about a canceled procedure.
kendte_databrud_aendringer: Ingen databrud.Navnet på sygehuset kan ændre sig over tid, hvilket fremgår af sygehus-afdelingsklassifikationen, hvor det er muligt at se gyldighedsperioden for sygehuskoden med det pågældende navn. For at identificere navnet på sygehuset, ses der på, hvad sygehusets navn var i den periode, hvor den aflyste procedure skulle have fundet sted, hvilket fremgå af variablen d_odto i samme tabel.
kort_om_registeret: Landspatientregisteret er oprettet i 1976 og er et nationalt register over aktiviteten ved de danske sygehuse. tabellens_indhold: Tabellen indeholder oplysninger om aflyste procedurer, dvs. procedurer der har været planlagt, men som aldrig blev udført pga. aflysning
variablebeskrivelse: Sygehuset som skulle have udført den procedure, der blev aflyst.

short_register_description: The National Patient Register was established in 1976 and is a national register of the activity at the Danish hospitals. The register contains a description of which diseases the patients have had at the contact to hospitals and how these diseases have been treated. The register includes all patients at public and private somatic and psychiatric hospitals. The activity at the private hospitals is formally part of the National Patient Register, but as the private hospitals report to it. independent database unit MiniPas, this part of the National Patient Register is documented as a separate register MiniPas - LPR.
table_contents: The table contains information about canceled procedures, ie procedures that have been planned, but which were never performed due to cancellation
variable_description: The variable contains a serial number that is unique to a contact. Recnum is used to connect data about a contact from the various data sets that make up the National Patient Register.
known_data_break_changes: Recnum is unique within an update of the National Patient Register. This means that one contact can get a new recnum when updating the register, and that specific recnum when updating the register can be reused for another contact.
table_unit: A row in the table contains information about a canceled procedure.
kendte_databrud_aendringer: Recnum er unik inden for en opdatering af Landspatientregisteret. Det betyder at én kontakt kan få et nyt recnum ved opdatering af registeret, og at konkret recnum ved opdatering af registreret kan blive genbrugt til en anden kontakt.

tabellens_indhold: Tabellen indeholder oplysninger om aflyste procedurer, dvs. procedurer der har været planlagt, men som aldrig blev udført pga. aflysning

short_register_description: The National Diabetes Register (NDR) contains data on almost all persons in Denmark with diagnosed diabetes. The register contains for each person general data such as date of birth, gender, possible date of death and municipality of residence. In addition, information on date of inclusion in the register and inclusion criteria. The register contains information from 1990 onwards. However, it is only from 1997 onwards that included individuals are considered incidents. A full population of living and diagnosed diabetics in Denmark can thus be identified as of 31 December 1996. The register is formed by finding indicators that are a consequence of diabetes. If you meet one of a total of 6 different criteria that indicate that you have diabetes, you will be registered in the National Diabetes Register. The method makes it possible, on a national basis, to identify close to a entire population of diagnosed diabetics, which is internationally unique.In return, there will be no affiliate t as much medical information to the individual diabetic. For example, there is no information about the type of diabetes, as this is not determined with certainty for each individual. Also note that the National Diabetes Register only contains information about diabetics who have most likely been diagnosed with the disease. As diabetes often has a long course before it is diagnosed, it must therefore be expected that there will be a larger number of people who have diabetes but have not yet been diagnosed with the disease (dark numbers).
table_contents: The table contains information about the persons' place of residence over time at municipal and regional level. There is only information about residence in Danish municipalities / regions (excl. Greenland). Ie that there is no information on residence abroad.T_bopael is linked with t_diabetes via the variable v_cpr.The table is built around the variable c_kom. C_kom only contains municipality codes which have been valid from and including 2007. These are also used for the period 1990 - 2006, although these municipal boundaries were not valid yet. Calculations for this period will therefore be immediately geographically and can not be directly linked to a specific municipal administration.As with all inventories based on data in the register this table, one must take into account that a full population is only estimated to be formed at the end of 1996. Newly included persons can thus only are considered incidents from and including 1997.See also comments in the general description of the register.
variable_description: The variable indicates Danish (excl. Greenland) municipality of residence for persons in the register. A person may be registered with several municipalities of residence, as the variable covers the entire period from 1990 onwards. The variable can only be used in connection with the variables d_start and d_slut (respectively start and end date for the municipality of residence). The variable is central in calculations of eg prevalence and incidence on a municipal basis.
known_data_break_changes: The variable uses the current municipal codes, which are valid from 2007. Please note that these municipal codes are also used for the period 2002 - 2006, even though the municipal boundaries, which the codes indicate, were not yet valid. However, calculations for this period 2002-06 will be immediately geographical and can not be directly linked to a specific municipal administration. In general, it is estimated that it is only from 1997 onwards that newly included persons can is considered an incident. This means that it first makes sense to form inventories where residence information gender is included from this year onwards. See also corresponding remarks in the description of the variable d_inkldto.
table_unit: A row in the table expresses that a person in the register has an address in a Danish municipality (excluding Greenland). A person may appear in several rows in the table. This will express that the person has lived in several different municipalities.
kendte_databrud_aendringer: Variablen benytter de aktuelle kommunekoder, som er gældende fra og med 2007. Vær opmærksom på, at disse kommunekoder også benyttes for perioden 2002 – 2006, selvom kommunegrænserne, som koderne angiver, endnu ikke var gældende.Dette muliggør, at der kan udarbejdes tidsserier på tværs af strukturreformen. Dog vil beregninger for denne perioden 2002-06 umiddelbart være rent geografisk og kan ikke direkte knyttes til en konkret kommunal forvaltning.Generelt skønnes det, at det først er fra og med 1997, at nyinkluderede personer kan regnes som incidente. Det betyder, at det først giver mening at danner opgørelser hvor bopælsoplysninger køn indgår fra og med dette år.Se også tilsvarende bemærkninger i beskrivelsen af variablen d_inkldto.
kort_om_registeret: Det Nationale Diabetesregister (NDR) indeholder data om tilnærmelsesvis alle personer i Danmark med diagnosticeret diabetes. Registeret indeholder for hver enkelt person almene data som fødselsdato, køn, evt. dødsdato og bopælskommune. Dertil kommer oplysninger om dato for inklusion i registeret og inklusionskriterium.Registeret rummer oplysninger fra 1990 og frem. Dog er det først fra og med 1997, at inkluderede individer regnes for incidente. En fuld population af levende og diagnosticerede diabetikere i Danmark,kan altså identificeres fra og med 31. december 1996.Registeret dannes ved at finde indikatorer som er en følge af diabetes. Opfylderman et af i alt 6 forskellige kriterier, som indikerer, at man har diabetes, vil man blive registreret i DetNationale Diabetesregister. Metoden gør det muligt, på landsbasis at identificere tæt på en hel population af diagnosticerede diabetikere, hvilket er internationalt enestående. Til gengæld vil der ikke være tilknyttet så mange medicinske oplysninger til den enkelte diabetiker. Fx er der ikke oplysninger om diabetestypen, da denne ikke med sikkerhed bestemmes for hver enkelt.Bemærk desuden, at det Nationale Diabetesregister alene indeholder information om diabetikere, der med stor sandsynlighed har fået sygdommen konstateret. Da diabetes ofte har et langt forløb inden den konstateres, må der derfor forventes at være et større antal personer, der har diabetes, men endnu ikke har fået konstateret sygdommen (mørketal).
tabelenhed: En række i tabellen udtrykker, at en person i registeret har adresse i en dansk kommune (ekskl. Grønland). En person kan optræde i flere rækker i tabellen. Dette vil udtrykke, at personen over tid har boet i flere forskellige kommuner.
tabellens_indhold: Tabellen rummer oplysninger om personernes bopælsforhold over tid på kommune- og regionsplan.Der er kun oplysninger om bopæl i danske kommuner/regioner (ekskl. Grønland). Dvs. at der fx ikke er oplysninger bopæl udlandet.T_bopael kobles med t_diabetes via variablen v_cpr.Tabellen er bygget op om variablen c_kom. C_kom indeholder udelukkende kommnekoder som har været gældende fra og med 2007. Disse benyttes altså også for perioden 1990 – 2006, selvom disse kommunegrænser ikke var gældende endnu.Beregninger for denne periode vil derfor i umiddelbart være rent geografisk og kan ikke direkte knyttes til en konkret kommunal forvaltning.Som ved alle opgørelser baseret på data i registeret denne tabel skal man tage højde for, at en fuld population først skønnes dannet ved udgangen af 1996. Nyinkluderede personer kan dermed først regnes for incidente fra og med 1997.Se også bemærkninger i den genereller beskrivelse af registeret.
variablebeskrivelse: I variablen angives dansk (ekskl. Grønland) bopælskommune for personer i registeret. En person kan være registreret med flere bopælskommuner, da variablen dækker hele perioden fra og med 1990.Variablen kan kun bruges i sammenhæng med variablene d_start og d_slut (hhv. start og slutdato for bopælskommunen).Variablen er central ved beregninger af fx prævalens og incidens på kommunebasis.

short_register_description: The National Diabetes Register (NDR) contains data on almost all persons in Denmark with diagnosed diabetes. The register contains for each person general data such as date of birth, gender, possible date of death and municipality of residence. In addition, information on date of inclusion in the register and inclusion criteria. The register contains information from 1990 onwards. However, it is only from 1997 onwards that included individuals are considered incidents. A full population of living and diagnosed diabetics in Denmark can thus be identified as of 31 December 1996. The register is formed by finding indicators that are a consequence of diabetes. If you meet one of a total of 6 different criteria that indicate that you have diabetes, you will be registered in the National Diabetes Register. The method makes it possible, on a national basis, to identify close to a entire population of diagnosed diabetics, which is internationally unique.In return, there will be no affiliate t as much medical information to the individual diabetic. For example, there is no information about the type of diabetes, as this is not determined with certainty for each individual. Also note that the National Diabetes Register only contains information about diabetics who have most likely been diagnosed with the disease. As diabetes often has a long course before it is diagnosed, it must therefore be expected that there will be a larger number of people who have diabetes but have not yet been diagnosed with the disease (dark numbers).
table_contents: The table contains information about the persons' place of residence over time at municipal and regional level. There is only information about residence in Danish municipalities / regions (excl. Greenland). Ie that there is no information on residence abroad.T_bopael is linked with t_diabetes via the variable v_cpr.The table is built around the variable c_kom. C_kom only contains municipality codes which have been valid from and including 2007. These are also used for the period 1990 - 2006, although these municipal boundaries were not valid yet. Calculations for this period will therefore be immediately geographically and can not be directly linked to a specific municipal administration.As with all inventories based on data in the register this table, one must take into account that a full population is only estimated to be formed at the end of 1996. Newly included persons can thus only are considered incidents from and including 1997.See also comments in the general description of the register.
variable_description: The variable indicates Danish (excl. Greenland) region of residence for persons in the register. A person may be registered with several regions of residence, as the variable covers the entire period from and including 1990. The variable is immediately derived from c_kom and is necessary for calculations. of eg prevalence and incidence on a regional basis.
known_data_break_changes: The variable uses the current region codes, which are valid from and including 2007. These are also used for the period 1990 - 2006, although the regions were not yet valid. Calculations for this period will therefore be immediately geographical and can not directly linked to a specific regional administration. In general, it is estimated that it is only from 1997 onwards that newly included persons can be regarded as incidents. This means that it only makes sense to form statements where residence information is only included from this year onwards. also corresponding remarks in the description of the variable d_inkldto.
table_unit: A row in the table expresses that a person in the register has an address in a Danish municipality (excluding Greenland). A person may appear in several rows in the table. This will express that the person has lived in several different municipalities.
kendte_databrud_aendringer: Variablen benytter de aktuelle regionskoder, som er gældende fra og med 2007. Disse benyttes også for perioden 1990 – 2006, selvom regionerne ikke var gældende endnu.Beregninger for denne periode vil derfor i umiddelbart være rent geografisk og kan ikke direkte knyttes til en konkret regional forvaltning.Generelt skønnes det, at det først er fra og med 1997, at nyinkluderede personer kan regnes som incidente. Det betyder, at det først giver mening at danner opgørelser hvor bopælsoplysninger kun indgår fra og med dette år.Se også tilsvarende bemærkninger i beskrivelsen af variablen d_inkldto.
kort_om_registeret: Det Nationale Diabetesregister (NDR) indeholder data om tilnærmelsesvis alle personer i Danmark med diagnosticeret diabetes. Registeret indeholder for hver enkelt person almene data som fødselsdato, køn, evt. dødsdato og bopælskommune. Dertil kommer oplysninger om dato for inklusion i registeret og inklusionskriterium.Registeret rummer oplysninger fra 1990 og frem. Dog er det først fra og med 1997, at inkluderede individer regnes for incidente. En fuld population af levende og diagnosticerede diabetikere i Danmark,kan altså identificeres fra og med 31. december 1996.Registeret dannes ved at finde indikatorer som er en følge af diabetes. Opfylderman et af i alt 6 forskellige kriterier, som indikerer, at man har diabetes, vil man blive registreret i DetNationale Diabetesregister. Metoden gør det muligt, på landsbasis at identificere tæt på en hel population af diagnosticerede diabetikere, hvilket er internationalt enestående. Til gengæld vil der ikke være tilknyttet så mange medicinske oplysninger til den enkelte diabetiker. Fx er der ikke oplysninger om diabetestypen, da denne ikke med sikkerhed bestemmes for hver enkelt.Bemærk desuden, at det Nationale Diabetesregister alene indeholder information om diabetikere, der med stor sandsynlighed har fået sygdommen konstateret. Da diabetes ofte har et langt forløb inden den konstateres, må der derfor forventes at være et større antal personer, der har diabetes, men endnu ikke har fået konstateret sygdommen (mørketal).
tabelenhed: En række i tabellen udtrykker, at en person i registeret har adresse i en dansk kommune (ekskl. Grønland). En person kan optræde i flere rækker i tabellen. Dette vil udtrykke, at personen over tid har boet i flere forskellige kommuner.
tabellens_indhold: Tabellen rummer oplysninger om personernes bopælsforhold over tid på kommune- og regionsplan.Der er kun oplysninger om bopæl i danske kommuner/regioner (ekskl. Grønland). Dvs. at der fx ikke er oplysninger bopæl udlandet.T_bopael kobles med t_diabetes via variablen v_cpr.Tabellen er bygget op om variablen c_kom. C_kom indeholder udelukkende kommnekoder som har været gældende fra og med 2007. Disse benyttes altså også for perioden 1990 – 2006, selvom disse kommunegrænser ikke var gældende endnu.Beregninger for denne periode vil derfor i umiddelbart være rent geografisk og kan ikke direkte knyttes til en konkret kommunal forvaltning.Som ved alle opgørelser baseret på data i registeret denne tabel skal man tage højde for, at en fuld population først skønnes dannet ved udgangen af 1996. Nyinkluderede personer kan dermed først regnes for incidente fra og med 1997.Se også bemærkninger i den genereller beskrivelse af registeret.
variablebeskrivelse: I variablen angives dansk (ekskl. Grønland) bopælsregion for personer i registeret. En person kan være registreret med flere bopælsregioner, da variablen dækker hele perioden fra og med 1990.Variablen er umiddelbart afledt af c_kom og er nødvendig ved beregninger af fx prævalens og incidens på regionsbasis.

variable_description: The variable indicates the end date of residence in the municipality in question. The variable is needed in conjunction with the variables c_kom and d_start.

variable_description: The variable indicates the start date of the municipality of residence. Newly included persons can thus only are considered incidents from and including 1997.See also comments in the general description of the register.
variable_description: The variable indicates the civil registration number for persons included in the NDR. Since the variable indicates individuals, it is central in all types of calculations and calculations. The variable is also a key variable when linking the tables td_diabetes and dt_bopael.
known_data_break_changes: It is estimated that it is only from 1997 onwards that newly included persons can be regarded as incidents. This means that statements of prevalence for a nationwide population can be made from 31 December 1996. The incidence of individuals who are diagnosed in 2001, as well as the period 2005 - 10 may be underestimated, This is due to changes in the podiatrists' agreements and thus performance patterns.This has probably again led to a decrease in the number of people included via foot therapy as an inclusion criterion.See also corresponding comment below the variables d_foot and d_inklaarsag.
table_unit: A row in the table expresses that a person in the register has an address in a Danish municipality (excluding Greenland). A person may appear in several rows in the table. This will express that the person has lived in several different municipalities.
kendte_databrud_aendringer: Det skønnes, at det først er fra og med 1997, at nyinkluderede personer kan regnes som incidente.Det betyder opgørelser af prævalens for en landsdækkende population, kan foretages fra og med 31. december 1996.Forekomsten af enkeltindivider, der er diagnosticerede i 2001, samt perioden 2005 – 10 kan være underestimeret, Dette skyldes ændringer i fodterapeuternes overenskomster og dermed ydelsesmønster. Dette har sandsynligvis igen medført et fald i antal personer, der er inkluderet via ”fodterapi” som inklusionskriterium. Se også tilsvarende kommentar under variablene d_fodt og d_inklaarsag.

variablebeskrivelse: Variablen angiver cpr-nummer for personer inkluderet i NDR.Dan variablen angiver enkeltindivider, er den central i alle typer opgørelser og beregninger.Variablen er desuden nøglevariabel ved kobling mellem tabellerne td_diabetes og dt_bopael.

table_contents: The table contains two types of information for persons in the register.1.Information for each person's inclusion in the register: Ie inclusion date, reason for inclusion (which criterion was met by inclusion in the register). In addition, there is information about, which inclusion criteria you may otherwise meet and dates for these.2.Basic information such as civil registration number, date of birth, sex and possibly date of death.T_diabetes can be linked to t_bopael via the variable v_cpr.In all statements based on data in the table, , that a full population is not estimated to be formed until the end of 1996. Newly included persons can thus only be considered incidents from and including 1997. See also remarks in the general description of the register.
variable_description: The variable indicates the gender of a person included in the register. The variable is central in all calculations of distributions by gender.
table_unit: A row in the table expresses that a person is included in the register. A person can not appear in several rows in the table.

Opfylderman et af i alt 6 forskellige kriterier, som indikerer, at man har diabetes, vil man blive registreret i DetNationale Diabetesregister. Til gengæld vil der ikke være tilknyttet så mange medicinske oplysninger til den enkelte diabetiker. Fx er der ikke oplysninger om diabetestypen, da denne ikke med sikkerhed bestemmes for hver enkelt.Bemærk desuden, at det Nationale Diabetesregister alene indeholder information om diabetikere, der med stor sandsynlighed har fået sygdommen konstateret. Da diabetes ofte har et langt forløb inden den konstateres, må der derfor forventes at være et større antal personer, der har diabetes, men endnu ikke har fået konstateret sygdommen (mørketal).
tabelenhed: En række i tabellen udtrykker, at en person er inkluderet i registeret. En person kan ikke optræde i flere rækker i tabellen.
tabellens_indhold: Tabellen rummer to typer oplysninger for personer i registeret.1.Oplysninger for hver enkelt persons inklusion i registeret: Dvs. inklusionsdato, inklusionsårsag (hvilket kriterium man opfyldte ved inklusion i registeret). Der ud over er der oplysninger om, hvilke inklusionskriterier man evt. ellers opfylder og datoer for disse.2.Basisoplysninger som cpr-nummer, fødselsdato, køn og evt. dødsdato.T_diabetes kan kobles til t_bopael via variablen v_cpr.Ved alle opgørelser baseret på data i tabellen skal man tage højde for, at en fuld population først skønnes dannet ved udgangen af 1996. Nyinkluderede personer kan dermed først regnes for incidente fra og med 1997.Se også bemærkninger i den genereller beskrivelse af registeret.
variablebeskrivelse: Variablen angiver kønnet for en person inkluderet i registeret.Variablen er central ved alle beregninger over fordelinger på køn.

reason_for_use: To know the criteria of inclusion to the register
short_register_description: The National Diabetes Register (NDR) contains data on almost all persons in Denmark with diagnosed diabetes. The register contains for each person general data such as date of birth, gender, possible date of death and municipality of residence. In addition, information on date of inclusion in the register and inclusion criteria. The register contains information from 1990 onwards. However, it is only from 1997 onwards that included individuals are considered incidents. A full population of living and diagnosed diabetics in Denmark can thus be identified as of 31 December 1996. The register is formed by finding indicators that are a consequence of diabetes. If you meet one of a total of 6 different criteria that indicate that you have diabetes, you will be registered in the National Diabetes Register. The method makes it possible, on a national basis, to identify close to a entire population of diagnosed diabetics, which is internationally unique.In return, there will be no affiliate t as much medical information to the individual diabetic. For example, there is no information about the type of diabetes, as this is not determined with certainty for each individual. Also note that the National Diabetes Register only contains information about diabetics who have most likely been diagnosed with the disease. As diabetes often has a long course before it is diagnosed, it must therefore be expected that there will be a larger number of people who have diabetes but have not yet been diagnosed with the disease (dark numbers).
table_contents: The table contains two types of information for persons in the register.1.Information for each person's inclusion in the register: Ie inclusion date, reason for inclusion (which criterion was met by inclusion in the register). In addition, there is information about, which inclusion criteria you may otherwise meet and dates for these.2.Basic information such as civil registration number, date of birth, sex and possibly date of death.T_diabetes can be linked to t_bopael via the variable v_cpr.In all statements based on data in the table, , that a full population is not estimated to be formed until the end of 1996. Newly included persons can thus only be considered incidents from and including 1997. See also remarks in the general description of the register.
variable_description: If the person meets the inclusion criterion Blood2i5, the variable will contain the date of fulfillment of the criterion. Otherwise the variable will be empty. The criterion blood2i5 is met when you have had at least two blood sugar measurements per year over a five-year period. This criterion follows the calendar year. for fulfillment, the date of the second blood glucose test is the fifth year.
table_unit: A row in the table expresses that a person is included in the register. A person can not appear in several rows in the table.

Metoden gør det muligt, på landsbasis at identificere tæt på en hel population af diagnosticerede diabetikere, hvilket er internationalt enestående. Til gengæld vil der ikke være tilknyttet så mange medicinske oplysninger til den enkelte diabetiker. Fx er der ikke oplysninger om diabetestypen, da denne ikke med sikkerhed bestemmes for hver enkelt.Bemærk desuden, at det Nationale Diabetesregister alene indeholder information om diabetikere, der med stor sandsynlighed har fået sygdommen konstateret. Da diabetes ofte har et langt forløb inden den konstateres, må der derfor forventes at være et større antal personer, der har diabetes, men endnu ikke har fået konstateret sygdommen (mørketal).

variablebeskrivelse: Hvis personen opfylder inklusionskriteriet ”Blod2i5” vil variablen indeholde datoen for opfyldelse af kriteriet. Ellers vil variablen være tom.Kriteriet blod2i5 er opfyldt, når man over en femårig periode har haft mindst to blodsukkermålinger per år. Dette kriterium følger kalenderåret. Datoen for opfyldelse er datoen for den anden blodsukkermåling det femte år.
